message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.RO, cs.SY, cs.CV 

The paper discusses a normative framework for hierarchical model-based policy optimization, which involves optimizing policies at different levels of abstraction. This is a topic that is relevant to several sub-fields of computer science, including machine learning (cs.LG), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), robotics (cs.RO), systems and control (cs.SY), and computer vision (cs.CV). Given that the paper focuses on developing a method for policy optimization, cs.LG and cs.AI are the most likely sub-categories. However, since the method is also applicable to robotics and control problems, cs.RO and cs.SY are also likely sub-categories. Finally, since the paper includes simulation results, which involve visual inputs, cs.CV is also a possible sub-category.
